result.execSummary:
The defendant Marion Thomas Brimley Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample, if not already done. Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessment and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation Agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised defendant of the following restrictions: Firearm possession and Voting.

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including drug and alcohol testing.
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- Court ordered defendant to comply with all Child Support Court Orders.
- Complete Parenting or Fatherhood course.
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Marion Thomas Brimley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
AS TO COUNT 1 - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
Court ordered defendant to serve 8 MONTHS in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; with release for work, inmate work assignments, and the Day Reporting Center; credit for 3 days time served. Court notes strong objections to electronic monitoring. 
Court STAYED the sentence and placed defendant on probation for 18 MONTHS with the following conditions:

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:

- Maintain Absolute Sobriety, no alcohol.
- No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid 
  prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
  and successfully complete recommended treatment
  including drug and alcohol testing. 
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm holster, firearm magazine, or any body armor.
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders. 
- Complete Parenting  or Fatherhood course. 
- Mental Health Evaluation and any recommended treatment.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
signed Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report dated April 16, 2015 received and filed. tk

Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report re: Missed Telephone Contact, received and filed. No action at this time.

Defendant Marion Thomas Brimley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
**ENTRY MADE WITHOUT THE COURT FILE**.   Case in court due to violation.  Arguments heard as to bail.  Court admonishes Defendant. Court amends conditions of bail from standard supervision to enhanced supervision, and to add sobriety treatment. All other conditons of bail to remain.  Case remains calendared for plea and sentencing hearing on 04-17-2015 in Branch 17.
Milwaukee County Pretrial Services Violation Report re: Drug Test-Positive, received and filed.

Defendant Marion Thomas Brimley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense counsel requests case be set for Projected Plea and Sentencing.  
Court reviews the Justice Point Report that was received March 9, 2015.  Court gives verbal warning to defendant.  No action taken at this time.
Court orders case for adjourned Projected Plea and Sentencing on 4-17-2015 at 1:30 p.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated March 6, 2015, received and filed.

Defendant Marion Thomas Brimley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  Ron Dague for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/23/15.
css

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Marion Thomas Brimley in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  
Defendant Marion Thomas Brimley in custody.  
Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
